intro: Cyclophyllum coprosmoides, commonly known as the coprosmoides cyclophyllum, is a rare and unique plant species belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, spirally arranged leaves that give it a striking visual appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. Its fruits are elongated and contain a single seed, which is encased in a fleshy, aromatic pulp. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, Cyclophyllum coprosmoides is considered a species of conservation concern.
